fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Budget, Trade, Competition, Consumers, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Communication, European Neighbourhood Policy

10 most important topics / initiatives: 
Energy Policy (e.g. Clean Energy Package) 
Climate Policy (e.g. EU Emissions Trading System) 
Connected & Automated Mobility 
Free Trade Agreements

Data Economy Package / Digital Single Market 
Health Technology Assessments (HTA) 
Cohesion Policy 
Circular Economy

membership:
Siemens AG and its consolidated subsidiaries are represented in a large number of associations worldwide. 
The most important ones on EU level are:  
 
Bundesverband Informationswirtschaft, Telekommunikation und neue Medien e.V. (BITKOM); BUSINESSEUROPE (only ASG); CER - Centre for European Reform European; DIGITALEUROPE; Roundtable of Industrialists (ERT); HEA - Fachgemeinschaft für effiziente Energieanwendung; ICC Germany; IBC - International Business Congress; Verband Deutscher Maschinen- und Anlagenbau e.V. (VDMA); Zentralverband Elektrotechnik- und Elektroindustrie e.V. (ZVEI)
relevant_communication: Charter of Trust for a secure digital world, published on 16 February 2018 at the Munich Security Conference (https://www.charter-of-trust.com)
goals__remit: Siemens AG (HQ in Berlin and Munich, founded in 1847) is one of the world's largest companies in electrical engineering and electronics. Siemens AG operates in the fields of electrification, automation and digitalization. The EU Government Affairs Liaison Office represents Siemens AG towards the EU institutions and related stakeholders.
